overview_of_class:
Turkish 121-1 is the first part of a three-quarter intermediate course in modern Turkish. It is designed for students who have completed Turkish 111 or equivalent. This course aims to continue basic Turkish grammar, and further develop reading, writing, speaking and listening skills acquired in Elementary Turkish, through the use of printed and audio-visual materials. The course also provides insights into modern Turkish culture through the language.

With this in mind, the course will focus on:
? knowledge and understanding of intermediate Turkish grammar as well as a wide range of Turkish vocabulary, structures and expressions
? the ability to understand and produce passages in written Turkish of medium length on everyday topics
? the ability to understand spoken Turkish and to engage in spoken discourse of medium complexity on everyday topics

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Successful completion of Turkish 111-3 or permission of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures on grammar are based mainly on Robert Underhill's Turkish Grammar and Suzan Özel's Elementary Turkish: A Communicative Approach, with occasional reference to Geoffrey Lewis's Turkish Grammar. Audio materials based on Özel's work are also available online.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Homework consisting of (but not limited to) assignments from the exercises in the textbook/handouts. One midterm and one final exam/project, as well as grammar and vocabulary quizzes to determine the general level of progress in the classroom.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Lectures on grammar, listening exercises, and homework assignments are based on Kurtulu? Öztopçu's Elementary Turkish: A Complete Course for Beginners. Revised Third Edition. The two-volume textbook can be purchased online at http://www.elementaryturkish.com/buy/. Additional materials will be provided by the instructor.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Full attendance and active class participation are strongly encouraged for the successful completion of the course. In addition to regular participation in class activities, it is important to complete all your homework on time.
